page.title: 10LANDSCAPE
page.content: Tewkesbury is situated on the confluence of the rivers Severn and Avon,both of which are kept in excellent order by the work of the Severn Trent River Authority and the Lower Avon Navigation Trust. A large tourist industry has evolved around the many types of boat now using these rivers and Tewkesbury has its own yacht marina. Around the two rivers there is a large flood zone,Tewkesbury being right in the middle.This has stopped any expansion of the town being possible, population having changed little over the centuries.Workings to the river banks and Tewkesbury's roadways make it easier for the people to travel in times of flood, but on several occasions each year,the land between the two rivers,known as 'The Ham',is completely under water.
